Topics: Biographical information on narrator Thabit ibn Aslam al-Bunani

hadiths.english_translation: He heard from Ibn Umar and Ibn al-Zubayr. Shu'bah heard from him. Sulayman ibn Harb told us: from Hammad ibn Zayd from his father, Anas said: Thabit is a key of good (benefits). Muhammad ibn Mahbub told me: Thabit told us Abu Salamah a hadith scholar, from Ja'far ibn Sulayman: Thabit died in 123 AH. It is said: according to Muhammad ibn Thabit, he died in 127 AH at the age of 86 years. Ali ibn al-Husayn from his father narrated: I heard Abdullah ibn Mughaffal at Hudaybiyyah. He said: I accompanied Anas for forty years and I did not see anyone more devoted to worship than him. It is said: al-Bunani (his nisba) refers to the sons of Sa'd ibn Luay ibn Ghalib whose mother was Bunani (a woman's name), or they are the sons of Sa'd ibn Dubay'a ibn Rabi'a ibn Nizar, or they are in Rabi'ah in Yamama, and the sons of al-Harith ibn Luay also in Yamama in Rabi'ah.

chainIssues: This is primarily a biographical entry with embedded transmission references
Multiple variant accounts are provided about Thabit's death year and age
Contains genealogical information about the Bunani tribe/nisba

potential_issues.issue: Biographical entry with multiple transmission and genealogical references
potential_issues.impact: This entry combines biographical information, transmission references, genealogical details, and variant reports about dates and ages

potential_issues.issue: Multiple conflicting date reports
potential_issues.impact: Different sources provide conflicting information about Thabit's death year (123 or 127 AH) and age (86 years)

hadiths.IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Biographical information on Thabit ibn Aslam
Praise of Thabit's devotion to worship
Genealogical information about the Bunani nisba
